tool.name: Find-gene-by-terms
tool.description: Find gene(s) using a single or list of text terms/phrases

param.name: table
param.help: The info is obtained from gene annotations for several rice genomes (from GFF or other info sources).
param.label: Which genome do you wish to search?
param.option: O. sativa Nipponbare cDNA RGAP7 annotation
O. sativa Nipponbare canonical genes OGRO annotation 2020-05

param.name: source
param.label: Type in term(s) directly, OR use terms list from history?
param.help: You can either type the term(s) directly to search, or use multiple terms in a file from history. Search includes partial matches.
param.option: Use a list of terms/phrases from the history

param.name: term
param.label: Search term
param.help: Directly type in your search term/phrase to find the genes (example: seed storage).

param.name: terms
param.label: Select list of terms to search (search is OR operation)
param.help: UPLOAD a list file with the terms to search, 1 search term per line only, NO BLANKS!

param.name: casesensitive
param.label: Case-sensitive search or not?
param.help: Upper/lower case distinction enforced or not?

param.name: wordmat
param.label: Whole word or partial match search?
param.help: Match only whole words enforced or not?

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Find-gene rice - what it does**
Retrieves list of genes that match the search terms (either directly typed in, or from a list), using the annotation description for the selected rice genomes::
Nipponbare (temperate japonica) Azucena (tropical japonica) N22 (aus) IR64 (indica) ...
Multiple search terms are prepared as list (1 search term per line, NO BLANKS) and uploaded to Galaxy using Get Data, see sample list below::
auxin flowering seed storage
BLANK line(s) are treated as SEARCH ANYTHING by the tool!
More genomes to come.
